Upload

Use the upload component to select or drag and drop one or more files in the upload field. Alternatively, the user can upload one or more files by clicking the link in the upload field and selecting the file(s) in the File menu.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-upload

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-upload

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-upload/src/scss/upload";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Import JS

                  
                  import { Upload } from '@govflanders/vl-ui-upload';

Info and options

[data-vl-upload] or .vl-upload (deprecated) Used to initialize the upload component Don't forget to put your component inside a form tag with enctype="multipart/form-data" attribute. Note: This upload component provides styles, and some basic setup for uploads.

Drag-and-drop

[data-vl-upload-full-body-drop] Use the full body drop implementation only for a single upload

Maximum file size

[data-vl-upload-max-size] Specifies the maximum file size (in bytes), if the user uploads one or more files that exceed that size, an error is triggered. [data-vl-error-message-filesize] Specifies the error message displayed when the maximum file size is exceeded

Multiple files

[multiple] Allows the user to upload multiple files at once [data-vl-upload-multiple-caption] Sets a custom message when the user can upload multiple files at once.

Maximum amount of files

[data-vl-upload-max-files] Sets the maximum amount of files that can be uploaded (default is 1). When the [multiple] attribute is used, there is no limit to the amount of files that can be uploaded. [data-vl-upload-error-message-maxfiles] Specifies the message that is shown when the error occurs.

Filetype

[data-vl-upload-accepted-files] Makes it possible to specify a type of file (or files) you want to allow in the upload. This is a comma separated list of file extensions or mime types. Eg.: image/*, application/pdf, .bmp

Duplicates

[data-vl-upload-disallow-duplicates] Default the upload allows uploading the same file multiple times (as a normal upload does), adding the attribute *--disallow-duplicates will disallow uploading the same file over and over again.

      
  <div class="vl-upload"
    data-vl-upload
      data-vl-upload-url="https://httpbin.org/post"
    data-vl-upload-files-name="files">
  </div>

    
      
  <div class="vl-upload"
    data-vl-upload
      data-vl-upload-url="https://httpbin.org/post"
    data-vl-upload-files-name="files"
      data-vl-upload-error-message-filesize="De grootte van het bestand mag maximaal :maxFsz zijn."
    
      data-vl-upload-error-message-maxfiles="Je kan een maximaal van :maxfl file(s) uploaden."
    
      data-vl-upload-max-files="5"
    
      data-vl-upload-max-size="20000000"
    
      multiple
    >
  </div>

    
      
  <div class="vl-upload"
    data-vl-upload
      data-vl-upload-url="https://httpbin.org/post"
    data-vl-upload-files-name="files"
      data-vl-upload-error-message-accepted-files="Je kan enkel bestanden met een &#39;.png&#39; extentie uploaden"
    
      data-vl-upload-max-files="10"
    
      data-vl-upload-accepted-files=".png"
    
      multiple
    >
  </div>

    
      
  <div class="vl-upload"
    data-vl-upload
      data-vl-upload-url="https://httpbin.org/post"
    data-vl-upload-files-name="files"
      data-vl-upload-full-body-drop
    
      data-vl-upload-max-files="10"
    
      multiple
    
      data-vl-upload-autoprocess="true"
    >
  </div>

    
      
  <div class="vl-upload"
    data-vl-upload
      data-vl-upload-url="https://httpbin.org/post"
    data-vl-upload-files-name="files"
      data-vl-upload-full-body-drop
    
      data-vl-upload-max-files="10"
    
      data-vl-upload-disallow-duplicates="true"
    
      multiple
    
      data-vl-upload-autoprocess="true"
    >
  </div>

Templates for upload-layout

The upload is build on and is configurable by using template tags with a comparable layout as below. Add this somewhere inside your body to use these, it is important that the ID's stay the same.

      
  <template id="uploadTemplate">
    <div class="vl-upload__element">
      <div class="vl-upload__element__label">
        <button type="button" class="vl-upload__element__button vl-link">
          <i class="vl-vi vl-vi-paperclip" aria-hidden="true"></i>
          <span class="vl-upload__element__button__container"></span>
        </button>
        <small></small>
      </div>
    </div>
  </template>

  <template id="previewFilesWrapper">
    <div class="vl-upload__files">
      <div class="vl-upload__files__container"></div>
      <div class="vl-upload__files__input__container"></div>
      <button class="vl-upload__files__close vl-link vl-link--icon">
        <span class="vl-link__icon vl-vi vl-vi-trash" aria-hidden="true"></span>
        Verwijder alle bestanden
      </button>
    </div>
  </template>

  <template id="previewTemplate">
    <div class="vl-upload__file">
      <p class="vl-upload__file__name">
        <span class="vl-upload__file__name__icon vl-vi vl-vi-document" aria-hidden="true"></span>
        <span data-dz-name></span>
        <span class="vl-upload__file__size">
          (<span data-dz-size></span>)
        </span>
      </p>
      <div class="dz-error-message">
        <span data-dz-errormessage></span>
      </div>
      <button type="button" class="vl-upload__file__close vl-link vl-link--icon" data-dz-remove>
        <span class="vl-vi vl-vi-cross" aria-hidden="true"></span>
      </button>
    </div>
  </template>

  <template id="uploadOverlay">
    <div class="vl-upload__overlay">
      <p class="vl-upload__overlay__text">
        <span class="vl-link__icon vl-vi vl-vi-paperclip" aria-hidden="true"></span>
      </p>
    </div>
  </template>

Detect changes

On every fileChange of the upload component, the custom event vl.upload.hook.fileChange is triggered. This custom event is triggered on drop as well as on change. The event holds a list of all the uploaded files inside e.detail. You can also get a full list of all uploaded files per upload with vl.upload.dropzoneInstances[i].files where i is the index from your upload-instance (most of the time this will be 0, if you use one vl-upload per page).

The event bubbles upward so you can add the listener to the document as in the example, or on the element itself.

Apart from these listeners you can also use all events that dropzonejs supports: https://www.dropzonejs.com/#events

      
  <script>
    document.addEventListener('vl.upload.hook.fileChange', function (event) {
      console.log(event);
      console.log(vl.upload.dropzoneInstances[0].files);
    }, false);
  </script>
